title: Of Droughts & Flooding Rains
text:
Only registered TrekEarth members may write critiques. Photographer's Note 
I love a sunburnt country, A land of sweeping plains, Of ragged mountain ranges, Of droughts and flooding rains. I love her far horizons, I love her jewel-sea, Her beauty and her terror The wide brown land for me! - My Country by Dorothea Mackellar I took this photo on one of the loneliest stretches of road I've ever seen. There is no name for this place, and I'd driven for hours without seeing a single car, or town, but stopped here for a rest. In total I drove 4,000 kilometres on my Western Australian road trip. The solitude and silence really gets you thinking. After you lose your voice doing solo karaoke. PS: Really not happy with what TE is doing to the sharpness and colour rendering of photos. This image looks fine on my monitor, but when I upload, it's a dog's breakfast 
snunney has marked this note useful
